meanings.definition: To leave behind in a race or competition.
meanings.sent1: The cheetah was outdistancing the other animals in the race.
meanings.sent2: She was outdistancing her classmates in the sprint competition.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise joked that he was outdistancing the hare in the race.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was outdistancing all obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The champion runner was outdistancing all her opponents effortlessly.

meanings.definition: To surpass in achievement or development.
meanings.sent1: The young prodigy was outdistancing his peers in academic achievements.
meanings.sent2: The company was outdistancing its competitors in technological advancements.
meanings.sent3: The plant was outdistancing the others in growth, much to the gardener's surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was outdistancing all expectations in the art world.
meanings.sent5: The team's dedication was outdistancing their previous records in success.
